block.p: As part of Lincoln Center's Midsummer Night Swing dance party, next Wednesday at 9:15 p.m., there will be a dessert buffet with sweets by more than two dozen chefs.
As part of Lincoln Center's Midsummer Night Swing dance party, next Wednesday at 9:15 p.m., there will be a dessert buffet with sweets by more than two dozen chefs.

Admission, which includes dancing, from 6:15 to 11 p.m., and dessert is $35; $25 for dessert only. Tickets will be sold at the Josie Robertson Plaza the evening of the performance. Information: (212) 875-5766.

Long Island wines will be featured at a dinner on Tuesday at 7 p.m. for the 40th anniversary of La Caravelle, 33 West 55th Street, with a benefit for the American Institute of Wine and Food. The dinner is $100 for members, $125 for nonmembers; reservations: (212) 447-0456.

Tours of Lincoln Center can be supplemented with ''Klaviers and Caviar'': a visit to Klavierhaus, 43 West 64th Street, a restorer of pianos, with some historic ones on display, followed by a tasting of blini with Russian sevruga caviar, salmon roe and codfish-roe spread at Petrossian, 182 West 58th Street.

The price for the package is $49.25 a person and includes a 15 percent discount at the Petrossian Cafe and Boutique. The tours are given daily at 10:30 a.m. and 12:30, 2:30 and 4:30 p.m. With the tasting, the event lasts about two and a half hours. Reservations: (212) 875-5370.

Each Saturday at 2 p.m., through Aug. 26, Palmer Vineyards in Aquebogue, N.Y., will offer a free tasting of dishes prepared with Long Island seafood and produce to those who buy a glass of the day's featured wine. Reservations not required. Information: (631) 722-9463, ext. 12.
